alert.note: Alert for Southampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 15 at 2:58PM EST until January 19 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Nottoway River At Sebrell affecting Southampton County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nottoway River at Sebrell. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Water crosses Indian Town Road and US Highway 58 Business in Courtland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 19.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:15 PM EST Monday was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...The river crested at a level of 19.6 feet earlier today. It is forecast to slowly fall through midweek, eventually falling below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.6 feet on 05/01/1952. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EST.
